edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Lol

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Lol

  • public abstract class Lol
extends Game
    A Lol object is the outermost container for all of the functionality of the game. It implements ApplicationListener (through Game), which provides hooks for GDX to render the game, stop it, resume it, etc. Lol is not responsible for doing anything significant. It keeps track of which screen is currently in use, and forwards (through Game) to that screen. Splash screens, Choosers, Help, and playable Levels each implement Screen, so that they can do the real work.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lol

        public Lol()
        The constructor just creates a media object and calls configure, so that all of our globals will be set. Doing it this early lets us access the configuration from within the LWJGL (Desktop) main class. That, in turn, lets us get the screen size correct (see the desktop project's Java file).

    • Method Detail

      • doSplash

        public static void doSplash()
        Use this to load the splash screen

      • doChooser

        public static void doChooser(int whichChooser)
        Use this to load the level-chooser screen. Note that when the chooser is disabled, we jump straight to level 1.
        Parameters:
        whichChooser - The chooser screen to create

      • doLevel

        public static void doLevel(int which)
        Use this to load a playable level.
        Parameters:
        which - The index of the level to load

      • doHelp

        public static void doHelp(int which)
        Use this to load a help level.
        Parameters:
        which - The index of the help level to load

      • doStore

        public static void doStore(int which)
        Use this to load a screen of the store.
        Parameters:
        which - The index of the help level to load

      • doQuit

        public static void doQuit()
        Use this to quit the game

      • toggleMute

        public static void toggleMute()
        Use this to manage the state of Mute

      • getVolume

        public static boolean getVolume()
        Use this to determine if the game is muted or not. True corresponds to not muted, false corresponds to muted.

      • getUnlockMode

        public static boolean getUnlockMode()
        Report whether all levels should be treated as unlocked. This is useful in Chooser, where we might need to prevent some levels from being played.

      • handleBack

        public void handleBack()
        When the back key is pressed, or when we are simulating the back key being pressed (e.g., a back button), this code runs.

      • create

        public void create()
        This is an internal method for initializing a game. User code should never call this.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This is an internal method for quitting a game. User code should never call this.

      • render

        public void render()
        This is an internal method for drawing game levels. User code should never call this.

      • loadResources

        public abstract void loadResources()
        Register any sound or image files to be used by the game

      • configure

        public abstract void configure()
        Set up all the global configuration options for the game
